events.message: Customer reported a severe car collision resulting in extensive front-end damage and filed a claim immediately after the incident.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the nature of the vehicle collision described.
An insurance agent was assigned to the claim to guide the customer through the assessment and documentation process.
The claim was officially acknowledged, and the customer received confirmation that their case is being processed.
The agent requested additional evidence including police reports, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates.
Customer submitted all requested documents such as the police report, accident photographs, and a mechanic's repair evaluation.
An investigation into the accident circumstances and liability began to ensure a fair and thorough review of the claim.
The investigation concluded with confirmation that the customer was not at fault and that damages are covered by the policy.
A settlement offer was proposed based on the repair estimate and coverage limits outlined in the insurance policy.
Customer responded positively to the settlement offer indicating satisfaction with the proposed compensation amount.
The claim was approved following customer agreement to the settlement terms and verification of all documentation.
Payment was issued to the customer’s bank account to cover the approved repair costs as detailed in the settlement.
The claim was officially closed after the customer confirmed receipt of the settlement and completion of repairs.
All documents and records related to the claim have been archived securely in the company’s database for future reference.
